questiontext.text: Which of the following is not a business resource?
Which level of management is responsible for controlling day-to-day operations?
The value of information for users is determined by all of the following but
An example of a financial transaction is
The major difference between the Financial Reporting System (FRS) and the Management Reporting System (MRS) is the

answer.text: FRS provides information to internal and external users; the MRS provides information to internal users
FRS provides discretionary information; the MRS provides nondiscretionary information
FRS reports are prepared using information provided by the General Ledger System; the MRS provides information to the General Ledger System
FRS reports are prepared in flexible, nonstandardized formats; the MRS reports are prepared in standardized, formal formats

questiontext.text: The Transaction Processing System includes all of the following cycles except
When designing the data collection activity, which type of data should be avoided?
In a database, a complete set of attributes for a single occurrence of an entity class is called
Database management tasks do not include
Which activity is not part of the finance function?
Which function manages the financial resources of the firm through portfolio management, banking, credit evaluation, and cash receipts and disbursements?
The term “accounting independence” refers to

answer.text: separation of duties, such as record keeping and custody of physical resources

questiontext.text: Which of the following is not a cloud computing service?
Attestation services are performed by
The objectives of all information systems include all of the following except

answer.text: support for the stewardship function of management
support for the day-to-day operations of the firm

questiontext.text: An appraisal function housed within the organization that performs a wide range of services for management is
Advantages of cloud computing include all of the following except

answer.text: Access to whatever computing power is needed

questiontext.text: These are focuses on the system itself
All of the following are external end users except
The objectives of an information system include each of the following except

answer.text: support for the stewardship responsibilities of management

questiontext.text: Which system is not part of the expenditure cycle?
Which of the following is a turn-around document?
The order of the entries made in the general journal is by
Which account is least likely to have a subsidiary ledger?
A journal is used in manual accounting environments. What file is comparable to a journal in a computerized environment?
Which of the following is an archive file?

answer.text: a file of accounts receivable that have been written off

questiontext.text: The most important purpose of a turnaround document is to

answer.text: inform a customer of the outstanding amount payable
provide an audit trail for the external auditor
inform the bank of electronic funds deposits

questiontext.text: Data flow diagrams

answer.text: depict logical tasks that are being performed, but not who is performing them
illustrate the relationship between processes, and the documents that flow between them and trigger activities
represent relationships between key elements of the computer system
describe in detail the logic of the process

questiontext.text: When determining the batch size, which consideration is the least important?

answer.text: achieving economies by grouping together large numbers of transactions
balancing the trade off between batch size and error detection

questiontext.text: In contrast to a batch processing system, in a real-time system

answer.text: a lag occurs between the time of the economic event and when the transaction is recorded
relatively fewer hardware, programming, and training resources are required
a lesser resource commitment per unit of output is required
processing takes place when the economic event occurs

questiontext.text: The type of transaction most suitable for real-time processing is
Both the revenue and the expenditure cycle can be viewed as having two key parts. These are
Which method of processing does not use the destructive update approach?

answer.text: all of the above use the destructive update approach

questiontext.text: A file that stores data used as a standard when processing transactions is

answer.text: a reference file

questiontext.text: Real-time processing would be most beneficial in handling a firm’s
Which accounting application is best suited to batch processing?

answer.text: updating inventory reductions to the subsidiary ledger

questiontext.text: Operational efficiencies can be improved by

answer.text: updating accounts both common and unique to many concurrent transactions in real time.
updating accounts both common and unique to many concurrent transactions in batch mode.
updating accounts unique to many concurrent transactions in real time and updating common accounts in batch mode.
None of the above are true statements

questiontext.text: A common use for sequential coding is
When a firm wants its coding system to convey meaning without reference to any other document, it would choose
Which ethical principle states that the benefit from a decision must outweigh the risks, and that there is no alternative decision that provides the same or greater benefit with less risk?
All of the following are factors in the fraud triangle except

answer.text: Pressure exerted on an individual at home and job related

questiontext.text: For an action to be called fraudulent, all of the following conditions are required except
Forces which may permit fraud to occur do not include
Skimming involves

answer.text: stealing cash from an organization before it is recorded
Stealing cash from an organization after it has been recorded
manufacturing false purchase orders, receiving reports, and invoices
A clerk pays a vendor twice for the same products and cashes the reimbursement check issued by the vendor.

questiontext.text: The concept of reasonable assurance suggests that

answer.text: the cost of an internal control should be less than the benefit it provides
a well-designed system of internal controls will detect all fraudulent activity
the objectives achieved by an internal control system vary depending on the data processing method
the effectiveness of internal controls is a function of the industry environment

questiontext.text: The most cost-effective type of internal control is
A well-designed purchase order is an example of a
The bank reconciliation uncovered a transposition error in the books. This is an example of a
Which of the following is not an element of the internal control environment?

answer.text: the functioning of the board of directors and the audit committee

questiontext.text: Which of the following indicates a strong internal control environment?

answer.text: the internal audit group reports to the audit committee of the board of directors
there is no segregation of duties between organization functions
there are questions about the integrity of management
adverse business conditions exist in the industry

questiontext.text: Which of the following is the best reason to separate duties in a manual system?

answer.text: to avoid collusion between the programmer and the computer operator
to ensure that supervision is not required
to prevent the record keeper from authorizing transactions
to enable the firm to function more efficiently

questiontext.text: Which of the following is not an internal control procedure?
When duties cannot be segregated, the most important internal control procedure is
Employee fraud involves three steps. Of the following, which is not involved?

answer.text: converting the asset to a usable form

questiontext.text: The importance to the accounting profession of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act is that

answer.text: management will not override the company’s internal controls
management are required to certify their internal control system
firms will not be exposed to lawsuits

questiontext.text: The office manager forgot to record in the accounting records the daily bank deposit. Which control procedure would most likely prevent or detect this error?
All of the following are conditions for fraud except
Control activities under COSO include

answer.text: IT Controls, preventative controls, and Corrective controls
physical controls, preventative controls, and corrective controls.
general controls, application controls, and physical controls.
transaction authorizations, segregation of duties, and risk assessment

questiontext.text: Management can expect various benefits to follow from implementing a system of strong internal control. Which of the following benefits is least likely to occur?

answer.text: availability of reliable data for decision-making purposes.
some assurance that important documents and records are protected.

questiontext.text: Which of the following is not an issue to be addressed in a business code of ethics required by the SEC?

answer.text: All of the above are issues to be addressed

questiontext.text: Which statement is not correct? The audit trail in a computerized environment

answer.text: consists of records that are stored sequentially in an audit file
traces transactions from their source to their final disposition
is a function of the quality and integrity of the application programs
may take the form of pointers, indexes, and embedded keys

questiontext.text: Which statement is not correct? The goal of batch controls is to ensure that during processing
Which statement is not true? A batch control record

answer.text: control figures in the record may be adjusted during processing

questiontext.text: Which of the following is an example of input control test?
Which input control check would detect a posting to the wrong customer account?
The revenue cycle consists of

answer.text: two subsystems–sales order processing and cash receipts
three subsystems–sales order processing, credit authorization, and cash receipts

questiontext.text: The adjustment to accounting records to reflect the decrease in inventory due to a sale occurs in the
Copies of the sales order can be used for all of the following except
The customer open order file is used to
The shipping notice

answer.text: is a formal contract between the seller and the shipping company
is always prepared by the shipping clerk
informs the billing department of the quantities shipped

questiontext.text: Customers should be billed for back-orders when

answer.text: customers are not billed for backorders because a backorder is a lost sale

questiontext.text: Which of following functions should be segregated?

answer.text: opening the mail and making the journal entry to record cash receipts
maintaining the subsidiary ledgers and handling customer queries
providing information on inventory levels and reconciling the bank statement

questiontext.text: The most effective internal control procedure to prevent or detect the creation of fictitious credit memoranda for sales returns is to

answer.text: prenumber and sequence check all credit memoranda
require management approval for all credit memoranda

questiontext.text: Which department is least likely to be involved in the revenue cycle?
Good internal controls in the revenue cycle should ensure all of the following except

answer.text: inventory to be shipped is not stolen

questiontext.text: Internal controls for handling sales returns and allowances do not include

answer.text: computing bad debt expense using the percentage of credit sales
verifying that the goods have been returned
using the original sales invoice to prepare the sales returns slip

questiontext.text: Which department prepares the bill of lading?
A weekly reconciliation of cash receipts would include comparing

answer.text: the cash prelist with bank deposit slips
journal vouchers from accounts receivable and general ledger

questiontext.text: EDI trading partner agreements specify all of the following except
An advantage of real-time processing of sales is

answer.text: hard copy documents provide a permanent record of the transaction
data entry errors are corrected at the end of each batch

questiontext.text: The data processing method that can shorten the cash cycle is
Which journal is not used in the revenue cycle?
The credit department

answer.text: prepares credit memos when goods are returned
approves credits to accounts receivable when payments are received
authorizes the granting of credit to customers

questiontext.text: The revenue cycle utilizes all of the following files except
Which document is NOT prepared by the sales department?
Which of the following is NOT a common method for achieving multilevel security?
The purpose of the purchase requisition is to

answer.text: authorize the purchasing department to order goods

questiontext.text: All of the following departments have a copy of the purchase order except
The open purchase order file in the purchasing department is used to determine

answer.text: the quality of items a vendor ships
the best vendor for a specific item
the orders that have not been received

questiontext.text: The reason that a blind copy of the purchase order is sent to receiving is to

answer.text: inform receiving when a shipment is due
force a count of the items delivered
inform receiving of the type, quantity, and price of items to be delivered
require that the goods delivered are inspected

questiontext.text: When a copy of the receiving report arrives in the purchasing department, it is used to

answer.text: record the physical transfer of inventory from receiving to the warehouse

questiontext.text: Which document is least important in determining the financial value of a purchase?
In a merchandising firm, authorization for the purchase of inventory is the responsibility of
Because of time delays between receiving inventory and making the journal entry
Which of the following statements is not correct?

answer.text: the voucher system is used to improve control over cash disbursements
the sum of the paid vouchers represents the voucher payable liability of the firm
the voucher system permits the firm to consolidate payments of several invoices on one voucher
many firms replace accounts payable with a voucher payable system

questiontext.text: The documents in a voucher packet include all of the following except
The cash disbursement clerk performs all of the following tasks except

answer.text: reviews the supporting documents for completeness and accuracy

questiontext.text: Authorization for payment of an accounts payable liability is the responsibility of
In a firm with proper segregation of duties, adequate supervision is most critical in
The major risk exposures associated with the receiving department include all of the following except

answer.text: goods are accepted without a physical count
there is no inspection for goods damaged in shipment
inventories are not secured on the receiving dock

questiontext.text: In regards to the accounts payable department, which statement is not true?

answer.text: the purchase requisition shows that the transaction was authorized
the purchase order proves that the purchase was required
the receiving report provides evidence of the physical receipt of the goods
the supplier’s invoice indicates the financial value of the transaction

questiontext.text: Firms can expect that proper use of a valid vendor file will result in all of the following benefits except

answer.text: purchasing agents will be discouraged from improperly ordering inventory from related parties
purchases from fictitious vendors will be detected
the most competitive price will be obtained
the risk of purchasing agents receiving kickbacks and bribes will be reduced

questiontext.text: The document which will close the open purchase requisition file is the
If a company uses a standard cost system, inventory records can be updated from the
Copies of a purchase order are sent to all of the following except
A supplier invoice

answer.text: shows what was ordered even if all was not shipped
is sent by vendor to accounts payable

questiontext.text: The document that captures the total amount of time that individual workers spend on each production job is called a
Which internal control is not an important part of the payroll system?

answer.text: Supervisors verify the accuracy of employee time cards.
Paychecks are distributed by an independent paymaster.
Accounts payable verifies the accuracy of the payroll register before transferring payroll funds to the general checking accounting.
General ledger reconciles the labor distribution summary and the payroll disbursement voucher.

questiontext.text: Depreciation

answer.text: is calculated by the department that uses the fixed asset
allocates the cost of the asset over its useful life
results in book value approximating fair market value

questiontext.text: Which control is not a part of the Fixed Asset System?

answer.text: review of the assumptions used in the capital budgeting model
development of an economic order quantity model

questiontext.text: Which of the following is not a characteristic of the Fixed Asset System?

answer.text: Acquisitions are routine transactions requiring general authorization
Retirements are reported on an authorized disposal report form.
Acquisition cost is allocated over the expected life of the asset.
Transfer of fixed assets among departments is recorded in the fixed asset subsidiary ledger

questiontext.text: Where does the responsibility lie for reconciling the labor distribution summary and the payroll disbursement voucher?
In a manufacturing firm, employees use time cards and job tickets. Which of the following statements is not correct?

answer.text: Job tickets are prepared by employees for each job worked on, so an employee may have more that one job ticket on a given day
An individual employee will have only one time card.
The time reported on job tickets should reconcile with the time reported on time cards.
Paychecks should be prepared from the job tickets.

questiontext.text: Which of the following situations represents a serious control weakness?

answer.text: Timekeeping is independent of the payroll department.
Paychecks are distributed by the employees’ immediate supervisor.
Time cards are reconciled with job tickets.
Personnel is responsible for updating employee records, including creation of records for new hires.

questiontext.text: Which of the following is not a reasonable control for fixed assets?

answer.text: Proper authorization is required for acquisition and disposal of fixed assets.
Fixed asset records show the location of each asset.
Fully depreciated assets are immediately disposed of.

questiontext.text: Payroll uses time card data to do all of the following except
The personnel action form provides authorization control by
Personnel action forms are used to do all of the following except
The document that records the total amount of time spent on a production job is the
Accounts payable
The Fixed Asset System performs all of the following except

answer.text: tracks the physical location of fixed assets

questiontext.text: Asset maintenance involves

answer.text: adjusting the asset records to reflect the cost of physical improvements
keeping track of the physical location of the assets

questiontext.text: Asset disposal

answer.text: occurs as soon as an asset is fully depreciated
automatically initiates the purchase of a replacement asset

questiontext.text: Which of the following works like a credit card with the time clock?
Which of the following is popular among businesses with employees in the field who travel between clients and companies with foreign-based employees?
